place_description: Olive’s Clay Studio and Olive’s Coffee Shop are one and the same business. We are Coffee and Art Studio with Classes. Make an appoint today by email to talk to us!

reviews_data.review_text: This locally-owned gem on Fort Mill's Main Street is a great gathering place as a cafe, ceramics studio and shop, and the site the last Saturday of every month for an amazing jazz jam session of local talent, especially area college and high school students.  We were blown away by the level of talent last night. Thought we were in a NYC jazz club.  Don't miss this place on your travels!
Mr. Binkley approves.
Great customer service and cozy place for a great coffee

This is the most eclectic and adorable business in Ft. Mill. My first impression walking in was joy!  There was a beautiful sculpture in the window, a piano on the right (which someone was playing for fun), vibrant art on the walls, beautiful pottery on the shelves and a smiling face behind the coffee bar. I ordered a lemonade and it was delish! However, there is a surprise behind the curtain near the coffee bar. A fully functioning pottery studio with artists creating stunning work. I was floored. I can't believe there is so much talent in one place. The owner, Debbie, is a master potter, artist, muralist, and creates the posters for downtown events. In the evening (check schedule) there are lots of events. Jazz, open mic, music bingo, singer song writer nights all happen here as well. Go there and be amazed like I was!!
Neat little gem! The iced chai latte and muffin were excellent !

My wife and I were in this area the other day and saw this on Yelp so we checked it out. The atmosphere was pretty cute and kind of has an Alice in Wonderland vibe. My wife got a dirty chai which was not amazing. The chai flavor was pretty weak, and the service was not especially friendly. Cute pottery and art if you are looking for that.

I love Olive's! I take pottery classes here, and love the instructors and studio members. It's a very positive, encouraging atmosphere.

I'm not a coffee drinker, but I still like the cafe side of the business. They have scones and muffins and a few varieties of tea, and it's a nice place to chill, have good conversation, and see some local art. If you're there on a hot summer day, get their lemonade. Fresh squeezed and super refreshing!

If there's no on-street parking, there's more free parking behind the buildings- either turn right at Hobo's or left onto Confederate Street to find a spot.
Olive's is great!  Good coffee and friendly staff!

I've good experiences coming here the past few times! Drink tastes a little different every time I get it but never bad. Only issue I've ever really had is tables don't seem to be clean no matter what time I come. They're also randomly closed one morning with nothing posted in their website so I drove out just to drive 10 minutes back home. It's a small family owned business so I understand things happen just a little disappointed

Perfect spot for relaxing while you enjoy your coffee or any of the other beverages they offer. Love the art & handmade items they have available for purchase, adds a lot of charm to the place. Staff have always been very friendly and welcoming as well.

I absolutely love this place!! The coffee is always so excellent and the prices are amazing!!! When I need a good cup of coffee this is where I go! They are so nice and make you feel welcomed!!! If you are looking for a new go-to coffee shop this is the place!!! They also give amazing recommendations and I just have yet to find a better coffee shop!
It's home like atmosphere...for meeting with friends

Such a great spot! I got the seasonal coffee drink called the Spring Chick and it was perfectly balanced. The guy behind the counter was super helpful with drink descriptions and was very friendly! So so so happy I decided to stop in!
good drinks, limited food options and NOT a pottery painting place like it's advertised in some places!
Had hot mocha !
Amazing place, great coffee. Jazz nights the last Saturday of the month are a must go

Good Ambience. Shop has gallery, gifts and studio. Neatly decorated. Good service. Only Road side parking available. No Drive thru available. We have to do parallel parking. We need to be careful as the road has some heavy traffic. The coffee tastes good. Drip coffee, Iced coffee, cold brew, double espresso, americano, latte, cappuccino and other coffees available here.
We had our accountability group here today. What a cute place on Main St in Fort Mill. And great service too!
Definitely a coffee shop. Friendly service. Parking is a hindrance and food choice is prepackaged snacks and very basic bakery items. Worth the first try.

On Main St in Fort Mill, SC. Stopped in for an espresso and some pastry. Employees super friendly, service was fast and pastries excellent! They also have pottery classes in the back. Very charming. Recommend!
Very delicious coffee & comfortable seating.
Wonderful local coffee shop and art studio/gallery. Super friendly and delicious coffee.
It was a friendly, welcoming place to chill and get out of the heat.

Beware of buying clay kit deal/package for your kids. I got 2 deals for my kids, they got the clay and tools, and crafted beautiful works of art (my totally biased opinion). In Feb, I took it back to the store for them to color, glaze and bake them in the kiln to be finished. The kiln was broken and they had no idea when it would be fixed. I went back on June 21st and they couldn't find my kids stuff cuz according to them they keep them only for 60 days. I am upset that one they didn't give me a date when the kiln would be fixed,  second they didn't tell me they hold it for 60 days once finished. Finally the lady (I'm assuming is the owner) says if it is so important for you, you should have come back sooner! My kids are feeling so sad and heartbroken. What a horrible experience!
A hidden gem of Fort Mill stopped in to grab a coffee and will definitely come back.
Absolutely adorable!

Love the ambiance! And for the pottery, plant, candle, and coffee lovers this a definitely a go to!  Also free song Bingo was going on while I was there and definitely kept it fun and engaging while playing or waiting for drinks!

**I got the Lavender Honey Latte
Love supporting a local business! The guitar player was cool, however a little loud for trying to study, was expecting a quiet coffee shop but it was still really nice

My first time at Olive's Mud Puddle coffee shop. The eclectic decor was fun and cozy. The pottery and paintings are very creative and for sale, with classes available in the back. I treated myself to a blueberry goat cheese scone and hot matcha. The scone was fresh and delicious. The matcha was not too sweet and one of the best!
Great coffee and other beverages. Fantastic atmosphere.

This is a coffee shop. They also offer some pottery classes in the rear and I wasn't always sure if it was a coffee shop. The coffee is fantastic and really good quality. I was a bit skeptical and figured it'd be average but I was pleasantly surprised. The space seemed a bit quirky the first time I walked in but I think it's part of the artsy influence. They had a lot of pottery decor on display. I think that's also what makes it unique - I've really started to like the vibe.

They have a piano and offer some classic open mic nights -which you don't often find in a coffee shop anymore. If you're looking for a quiet place to read a book or a spot to meet with a friend, I'd recommend checking this place out.
Great place, had a good time at music bingo. Michael is always a great host and very funny. The treats and drinks are always great. The staff are wonderful. Still love this place.
Been here many times for coffee. They have really good single origin coffee they brew from time to time that is amazing.

New to the area, we stopped by on a Friday night. Upon entering it's clearly a local place that has a welcoming neighborhood-ie feel. Greeted with coffee aromas they also have a small but fine selection of wine and beer. It was Open Mic night when we arrived so we sat quietly sipping our drinks as John Morgan opened - all a fun, entertaining and talented group of people followed. A quiet, comfortable place to just relax and enjoy. An adorable place.

If you love art and coffee, then this is the place to be. It's easy to love this place the minute you walk in, from the smell of the rich coffee, to the quirky and quaint decor. The atmosphere was inviting. The owner and staff are super friendly, great service and flavorful drinks. If you're looking for vegan options, they have plenty of drink options to choose from including non-dairy milk for coffee drinks.
A fun experience for a Saturday afternoon.
Cute little coffee shop and love that they offer pottery classes
A lot of fun! Debbie talked us through our design phase. Very knowledgeable. You don't have to have any previous experience to do this. Good for groups or by yourself. Very soothing. Will go back!
Amazing coffee. Better than Starbucks
Awesome place! Coffees, great gifts, plus multi week pottery classes or paint and sips....with adult beverages. Just go check it out. Something for everybody.
Great coffee and friendly owners! I'd recommend to everyone! Beautiful art gallery too!
Debbie is the best! So talented, humble, and sweet.
Quaint and delicious. A living room vibe with delicious drinks and a friendly interesting staff.
Quaint little place in downtown Fort Mill.  Great place to have a drink or a coffee with friends.  Trivia nights are alot of fun. Come early to get a table.
They have open mic night once a month. Not sure when, but this place was busy with some amazing singers setting a great atmosphere. Def try to get there during open mic night.
Good  coffee  in a charming  artistic  setting .

Update 2: The Mud Puddle is back! Great barista and coffee!

Update 1:
After the first horrible coffee experience, I figured I'd give it a second chance. Unfortunately, the experience was the same. The barista was the same person, and the person seemed lost behind the counter. I miss the great cup of coffee. If it continues, I may have to look elsewhere.

Old reviews:
I love this place.  A gem in the heart of Fort Mill.  Great baristas, great pastries, great coffee!  The place is co-located with Olive's Art Studio and feature the works of local and aspiring artists as well as showcase the work of local students.
Ordered a mocha. Barista was nice. Coffee was a little weak. Place was nice.

Embarrassed it has taken me 7 years to visit this cute downtown coffee shop/store.

I have a sensitive nose, so upon entering it was an antiqueyesque (new word, Webster!) aroma but I quickly acclimated.

The barista was very sweet and helpful.  The food options are very limited but I did like they had scones from local Breadsmith.  I ordered the special pumpkin butter latte as it was a less sweet choice for the seasonal selections.  I didn't love it and will have to try another drink next time.  I throughly enjoyed sitting outside on Main Street.  Inside, seating is limited and for small parties.

This is a cute place and I'll return!  Is it my favorite place in Fort Mill?  No, but a great spot I'll stop by time to time.
Delightful little coffee shop. Lots of Knick Knacks to explore. Good coffee creations which always change.
First time at music bingo last night. Such a fun time! Definitely going back to make some fun creations!

We always stop in at Olive's for a coffee or hot chocolate after going on the tour of scarecrows in downtown Fort Mill.

I enjoyed a newly added menu item - Butter Beer Latte - which is absolutely scrumpscious - along with a pumpkin/chocolate chip muffin.

Best Coffee Shop in the entire county.  This place has a legit art studio.  it is chocked full of arts and crafts.  The staff here is also really great as well.  It can be a bit cluttered.  It is a really cool and creativity evoking joint.
The coffee was great and atmosphere was even better
Cute little coffee shop where you can buy art or create your own!
Great addition to downtown Fort Mill.
Great little place. Very artsy.  I can only assume that the owner must be very into the local art scene and I applaud that. I will be back if I'm in the area.
Such a nice cozy place. The place, the people, the atmosphere.  Relaxing and definitely different. In a nice downtown a nice spot to visit and enjoy some relaxing time.
it s just ok.

Quaint coffee shop locating inside a store with handmade gifts and art work. (Hint if you are trying to find it.)

Coffee was ok. Not a destination for a local hang out coffee bar but will do if you're in the neighborhood.
Fun place to stop and get a hand crafted beverage and look at the art for sale. Also in the back ceramics and painting classes, soaps for sale. Love this place!
Nice little place to get coffee, beer, and wine. There is plenty of art and pottery to look at. Maybe play chess or the piano.
El cafe y la atencion excelente!!!
Really cute place. Would like to have more comfy chairs to sit and relax. Beverages are good, muffins and Sweet Dough fritters are awesome.
Great coffee

Hands down the best coffee shop I've ever been to! Atmosphere is great, the coffee menu has all the fixings you'd expect from any other...but the ones I've tried had such a unique flavor other cafes can't deliver. Primarily serves drinks, with some cookies and ice cream available. If you enjoy the aesthetics of a "hole in the wall" coffee shop, look no further!
Olives mud puddle has the best coffee I've found. The staff are super friendly and very personable. The art is wonderful and the owner is so very nice. This place is amazing.

The homemade chai is to die for and the staff always remember my name. Great place to study, have a meeting or meet a friend to chat. The owner Debbie is an artist, so there's always interesting pieces to buy.

Very eclectic artsy coffee shop.
A little pricey but worth it

Wonderful place. Went to make a clay mug and had good time, great conversation and overall fun. Owner is very sweet and knowledgeable and really cares about the customer. Highly recommend and the coffee is fabulous.
Great place to catch up with a friend. Fun hats as well!
Great place, friendly staff. Uke meetup every first Sat. Fun.

Is nine months long enough to wait before you decide to rave again about your favorite pit stop? I literally stop here at minimum three times a week. And if I miss a day, I come the day after. After my knee surgery I forced my husband to chauffeur me here for a London Fog. I have stopped my schoolwork to stop in this place and brought my books in, too. The little trinkets around the shop for view and for sale are so enticing to linger through while your drink is made. I love seeing what's the next theme in the front display window. I don't do coffee often but if you like REAL TEA LATTES, not a teabag and milk, but a real tea latte, YOU NEED TO COME IN HERE!
------------
I've been coming here for a while now for coffee, but today was a little special for me. I asked the young lady behind the counter for an earl grey tea with a side of steamed milk. I was going to make my own London Fog, because everywhere I order it, nobody has a clue what I'm talking about. She looked right at me and said "I know exactly what it is, I can make it for you." I can't explain the feeling of relief I got when she said that. I wasn't met with the rudeness and pretentiousness I get from Starbucks, the clueless looks I get from Caribou Coffee... she KNEW my drink. The tea is a beautiful aromatic blend, and the milk was steamed to perfection. I'm literally nursing my tea because I know there's a bottom to my cup! The shop is so warm and inviting. I love the small quaint feeling. I will be a regular!

My sentiments about this shop had been shared by many. It's so cute, the staff very friendly and the coffee/selection is really amazing. The kicker for me was the 3 shots in a 16oz cup! Next time we're in the area, well be sure to stop in.
Love this place!

The BEST coffee in Fort Mill! Great friendly and knowledgeable staff that make you feel like family. Perfect drinks with house made syrups that taste sooooo yummy! AND there's great art and sometimes music! What more could you ask for? Definitely my favorite place to hang out.
Great coffee! Staff is awesome as well! Great neighbors on Main Street in Fort Mill! Sarah is da bomb!

Fantastic coffee and the shop has many interesting art pieces and such for purchase. I did not take part, but they also had an art studio there with wheels for the community to use as well as classes. I am hoping to take part in the classes in the future.

Olive's Mud Puddle is the coffee shop of your dreams. Located in down town Fort Mill next to Pucker Buts, Olive's Mud Puddle has places to meet for business and puzzles and games for kids. Their coffee is amazing and they have a variety of special holiday treats that are fantastic. This puddle also offers a large selction of local art for sale including but not limited to Snarks, realistic landscape painting, fine pottery, scuplture, photography, and so much more. Stop in today and experience a gem of Fort Mill.
I really enjoy the ambience everytime I visit Olive's Mud Puddle. And I'm a fan of their hot teas! :D  And their piano! :D
Love this place! Awesome atmosphere and best coffee in town.

Traveling again and looking for a coffee house to plant down open my laptop and work remotely.
Lucky me...I found Olive's Mud Puddle. A nice, delight and welcoming vibe with wonderful coffee.
Thank you Sara for a rewarding experience  : )
#coffee #espresso #lattes #cappuccinos #bakegoods #smallbusiness #FortMill #SC
Had such a great time forgot to take pictures. Sorry..
Fun experience. Great pottery items and super good coffee.
Cool place. Old school coffee shop vibe. Friendly folks.

Great coffee, love coming to be creative and hand build clay objects as well. The overall atmosphere is just welcoming and warm. We love to stop.in just to see the art on displayed and grab coffee too!
Great coffee and treats in the midst of a local art studio. How FUN!

What a great little shop.  Friendly service, GREAT coffee, very chill and pretty cool art work all around also.  Some local products, really a nice addition to the Main St. In Fort Mill.  Looking forward to coming back
Great coffee, delicious muffins, and a friendly staff featuring eclectic art.  Who could ask for more?
Quaint place to chill out and grab a refreshing drink with a friend. Will definitely be back next time I'm in the area!

There coffee is amazing and there tea there scones everything I've tried and I've loved. The scenery is adorable there's all sorts of seating including outside and up on a bar sort of thing. There's a typewriter,piano, etc. I LOVE IT.
Nice coffee. Cute shop. I would like to go back to hang out.
Cute little coffee shop. Service was friendly and quick and the coffee drinks were good. Quaint atmosphere and average prices - worth a look when you're in the area.
Great atmosphere! Great coffee! Great employees! Delightful!

After a miserable experience here many months ago I thought I would give it another try. Unlike the woman who acted as if I was a major inconvenience many months ago, the young man who served us last evening was extremely congenial. I know we were there close to closing time but he was happy to take care of us. The espresso was delicious as were the muffins we had as our dessert. The art work and pottery are beautiful and we look forward to returning.
Excellent coffee. Friendly atmosphere with a bohemian flair. Art and hand made pottery for sale. Great people.
Support local coffee shops! I drove extra 10 minutes to avoid the big corporations. Google wouldn't even show me anything other than Starcucks.
Great service, friendly staff, delicious latte's

Great place.  Quiet with a whole lot of charm !!! Nice to support a local privately owned place with even better coffee than these over priced chains ( wont mention the name). Sarah is a sweet barista and gave me samples to try . They also have cool jewelry and artwork for sale .
Wonderful! Amazing cookies and cream if you like sweet ice coffee.
Terrific atmosphere and friendly staff. The coffee is delicious, especially their frappes (IMHO). They also have dietary conscious recipes (gluten free, dairy free, etc...).
Yummy! Recommend when you have time to sit and visit while your drink is being made.

I always get friendly service. The coffee is great. My friend loves their fruit smoothies too. The atmosphere is so fun with all of the art work. There is always something new and different to look at.
She is so nice and reasonably priced.   So many choices.......
This coffee shop has great coffee and the service is spot on!! You can smell the coffee as soon as you walk in the door!! Smoothies and Fraps are tasty too!!
There coffee is ok, if you're a Starbucks or Not Just Coffee person, this place is eh. Also, it smells really strong of art stuff when you first walk in. Recommend sitting outside.
Unpretentiously artsy. Great coffee. Compelling local art.  Eclectic decor makes any visit a lot of fun.
A very nice place and relaxing setting to have coffee.
Neat place. The coffee is excellent and the staff is very friendly.
Our favorite Fort Mill coffee shop, kid friendly with treats and hot chocolate for them.
Love stopping here for coffee with a friend. Creative atmosphere.  Good coffee. Love downtown Fort Mill.

I honestly have no words. The Mud Puddle is 100% better than Starbucks or Peet's or any other coffee shop. You don't just go to this coffee shop, you EXPERIENCE this coffee shop. I've never been more in love with a drink.
Great little place with delicious coffee and always something interesting to look at!
Love love love it there! Great atmosphere and great drink selection and well as great quality drinks!
Fabulous coffee, fun atmosphere, great art studio.  Highly recommend!

I only stopped in to browse, but had the great fortune to meet Debbie, the owner. What an incredible opportunity for anyone interested in pottery, ceramics, or painting! For an unbelievable low fee, you get a month of studio time, materials included. She hosts art parties and holds workshops. You can also sell your works in the attached Mud Puddle coffee shop. Too much fun can be had.
The double espresso was fantastic
Great coffee, friendly faces!
My happy place in the morning
Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. Delicious coffee and baked goods too!
Best coffee, best service
Very confy place, alot of character come hang out.
Love this place!!
A hidden gem in Downtown Fort Mill.  A great place to meet friends or clients for a coffee meeting.  Skip the chain coffee shops and meet here.  You won't be disappointed!
Great little coffee shop! Currently displaying artwork from the High School, very awesome!
The best coffee!
A small, intimate setting that features local artist's work with great coffee. The barrista was friendly and knew what she was doing.
Excellent coffee, friendly & experienced staff, unique atmosphere with pottery studio at the rear and original art displayed everywhere (and for sale).
Great artist-friendly space.
Love it a lot, they can make you anything and everything to do with coffee and the owners and staff are great and have awesome stories all day!
Great coffee! Cool space with a laid back atmosphere.
Great atmosphere, Very friendly service and the coffee was delicious!
